036.name: Australia
036.fact: Australia is home to more kangaroos than people.

076.name: Brazil
076.fact: Brazil produces a third of the world’s coffee.

124.name: Canada
124.fact: Canada has more coastline than any other country.

156.name: China
156.fact: China’s Great Wall stretches over 21,000 km.

250.name: France
250.fact: France is the most visited country in the world.

276.name: Germany
276.fact: Germany is credited with inventing the printing press.

356.name: India
356.fact: India’s Kumbh Mela gathering is visible from space.

380.name: Italy
380.fact: Italy has more UNESCO World Heritage Sites than any other country.

392.name: Japan
392.fact: Japan has more than 5.5 million vending machines.

410.name: South Korea
410.fact: South Korea has the world’s fastest average internet speed.

458.name: Malaysia
458.fact: Malaysia’s Petronas Towers were the tallest buildings from 1998 to 2004.

528.name: Netherlands
528.fact: About a third of the Netherlands lies below sea level.

554.name: New Zealand
554.fact: New Zealand was the first country to give women the right to vote.

710.name: South Africa
710.fact: South Africa has three capital cities.

724.name: Spain
724.fact: Spain produces nearly half of the world’s olive oil.

752.name: Sweden
752.fact: Sweden’s capital Stockholm is built on 14 islands.

756.name: Switzerland
756.fact: Switzerland is famous for inventing modern milk chocolate.

792.name: Turkey
792.fact: Istanbul is the only city in the world spanning two continents.

818.name: Egypt
818.fact: Egypt’s pyramids aligned with the stars of Orion’s belt.

826.name: United Kingdom
826.fact: The UK’s London Underground is the oldest metro system, opened in 1863.

840.name: United States of America
840.fact: The United States has the world’s largest economy.

894.name: Zambia
894.fact: Zambia shares Victoria Falls with Zimbabwe.
